text: r=\frac{\sin \theta}{\theta}, -20<\theta<20 cochleoid (solid) and its polar inverse (dashed) A cochleoid is a snail-shaped curve similar to a strophoid which can be represented by the polar equation :r=\frac{a \sin \theta}{\theta}, the Cartesian equation :(x^2+y^2)\arctan\frac{y}{x}=ay, or the parametric equations :x=\frac{a\sin t\cos t}{t}, \quad y=\frac{a\sin^2 t}{t}. The cochleoid is the inverse curve of Hippias' quadratrix. Heinrich Wieleitner: Spezielle Ebene Kurven.
